Text: Financial Sector (Collection of Data) (reporting standard) determination No. 37 of 2021 Reporting Standard ARS 744.0 ABS/RBA Housing Credit Stocks, Flows and Interest Rates Financial Sector (Collection of Data) Act 2001
Interpretation/Simplification: This is the official title and legislative context for Reporting Standard ARS 744.0.

Text: I, Alison Bliss, delegate of APRA, under paragraph 13(1)(a) of the Financial Sector (Collection of Data) Act 2001 (the Act) and subsection 33(3) of the Acts Interpretation Act 1901:
Interpretation/Simplification: This identifies the authority (Alison Bliss, APRA delegate) issuing this determination under specified sections of the relevant Acts.

Text: revoke Financial Sector (Collection of Data) (reporting standard) determination No. 13 of 2019, including Reporting Standard ARS 744.0 ABS/RBA Housing Credit Stocks, Flows and Interest Rates made under that Determination; and
Interpretation/Simplification: The previous version of Reporting Standard ARS 744.0 (Determination No. 13 of 2019) is cancelled.

Text: determine Reporting Standard ARS 744.0 ABS/RBA Housing Credit Stocks, Flows and Interest Rates, in the form set out in the Schedule, which applies to the financial sector entities to the extent provided in paragraph 4 of the reporting standard.
Interpretation/Simplification: The new Reporting Standard ARS 744.0, as detailed in the Schedule, is officially established. Its applicability to financial entities is specified in paragraph 4 of the reporting standard.

Text: Under section 15 of the Act, I declare that the reporting standard shall begin to apply to those financial sector entities, and the revoked reporting standard shall cease to apply, on the day it is registered on the Federal Register of Legislation.
Last Date of Compliance: on the day it is registered on the Federal Register of Legislation
Interpretation/Simplification: The new reporting standard becomes legally binding for financial entities, and the old one ceases to apply, on the date it is officially registered on the Federal Register of Legislation.

Text: This instrument commences upon registration on the Federal Register of Legislation.
Interpretation/Simplification: This legal document itself becomes effective upon its official registration.

Text: Dated: 30 July 2021
Interpretation/Simplification: The date the determination was signed.

Text: Authorised Version F2021L01107 registered 13/08/2021
Interpretation/Simplification: The determination was officially registered on August 13, 2021, under the identifier F2021L01107, making it effective from this date.

Text: Interpretation In this Determination:
Interpretation/Simplification: This section provides definitions for terms used within this document.

Text: APRA means the Australian Prudential Regulation Authority.
Interpretation/Simplification: APRA is defined as the Australian Prudential Regulation Authority.

Text: financial sector entity has the meaning given by section 5 of the Act.
Interpretation/Simplification: The definition of 'financial sector entity' can be found in section 5 of the Financial Sector (Collection of Data) Act 2001.

Text: Schedule Reporting Standard ARS 744.0 ABS/RBA Housing Credit Stocks, Flows and Interest Rates comprises the document commencing on the following page.
Interpretation/Simplification: The detailed requirements for Reporting Standard ARS 744.0 are presented starting from the next page.

Text: Reporting Standard ARS 744.0 ABS/RBA Housing Credit Stocks, Flows and Interest Rates
Interpretation/Simplification: This is the title of the specific reporting standard being detailed.

Text: This Reporting Standard outlines the requirements for the provision of information to APRA relating to an authorised deposit-taking institution’s or registered financial corporation’s housing credit stocks, flows and interest rates. It includes Reporting Form ARF 744.0A ABS/RBA Housing Credit Stocks, Flows and Interest Rates (Standard) and Reporting Form ARF 744.0B ABS/RBA Housing Credit Stocks, Flows and Interest Rates (Reduced) and the associated specific instructions.
Interpretation/Simplification: The purpose of this standard is to collect information from banks (ADIs) and financial corporations (RFCs) about housing credit and interest rates using two specific forms: ARF 744.0A (Standard) and ARF 744.0B (Reduced).

Text: 1. This Reporting Standard is made under section 13 of the Financial Sector (Collection of Data) Act 2001.
Interpretation/Simplification: This reporting standard is issued under the authority of section 13 of the Financial Sector (Collection of Data) Act 2001.

Text: 2. Information collected by Reporting Form ARF 744.0A ABS/RBA Housing Credit Stocks, Flows and Interest Rates (Standard) (ARF 744.0A) and Reporting Form ARF 744.0B ABS/RBA Housing Credit Stocks, Flows and Interest Rates (Reduced) (ARF 744.0B) is used by the ABS and RBA for various purposes, including for policy and statistical purposes. This information may also be used by APRA for prudential and publication purposes.
Interpretation/Simplification: The data submitted via forms ARF 744.0A and ARF 744.0B will be used by the Australian Bureau of Statistics (ABS) and the Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) for policy and statistical analysis, and by APRA for prudential oversight and public reporting.

Text: 3. This Reporting Standard is an Economic and Financial Statistics (EFS) Reporting Standard for the purposes of Reporting Standard ARS 701.0 ABS/RBA Definitions for the EFS Collection (ARS 701.0).
Interpretation/Simplification: This standard is part of the broader Economic and Financial Statistics (EFS) collection, and definitions for terms used herein can be found in Reporting Standard ARS 701.0.

Text: 4. This Reporting Standard applies to an authorised deposit-taking institution (ADI) or registered financial corporation (RFC) as set out in the table below, where ‘housing credit’ is measured by the value reported in item 1.1.1.1.1 (column 1) on Reporting Form ARF 720.1A/B ABS/RBA Loans and Finance Leases (Standard)/(Reduced) (ARF 720.1A/B) and ‘deposits’ are measured by the value reported in item 14 on Reporting Form ARF 720.0A/B ABS/RBA Statement of Financial Position (Standard)/(Reduced) (ARF 720.0A/B).
Interpretation/Simplification: This standard applies to ADIs and RFCs based on specific thresholds for 'housing credit' (as defined in ARF 720.1A/B) and 'deposits' (as defined in ARF 720.0A/B), which are further detailed in the accompanying table.

Text: Class of financial institution ARF 744.0A ARF 744.0B ADIs Yes if housing credit ≥ $6 billion and deposits ≥ $25 billion Yes if housing credit ≥ $6 billion and deposits < $25 billion
Interpretation/Simplification: Authorised Deposit-taking Institutions (ADIs) must use Form ARF 744.0A if their housing credit is $6 billion or more AND deposits are $25 billion or more. ADIs must use Form ARF 744.0B if their housing credit is $6 billion or more AND deposits are less than $25 billion. These are the thresholds determining which reporting form an ADI must use.

Text: RFCs Yes if housing credit ≥ $6 billion and deposits ≥ $25 billion Yes if housing credit ≥ $6 billion and deposits < $25 billion
Interpretation/Simplification: Registered Financial Corporations (RFCs) must use Form ARF 744.0A if their housing credit is $6 billion or more AND deposits are $25 billion or more. RFCs must use Form ARF 744.0B if their housing credit is $6 billion or more AND deposits are less than $25 billion. These are the thresholds determining which reporting form an RFC must use.

Text: 5. APRA may from time to time determine that a higher threshold will apply to a particular ADI or RFC than that specified in paragraph 4 of this Reporting Standard and if APRA does so it will notify the ADI or RFC concerned in writing.
Interpretation/Simplification: APRA retains the right to impose higher reporting thresholds for specific ADIs or RFCs than those generally listed in paragraph 4. If this happens, the affected institution will be notified in writing.

Text: 6. This Reporting Standard applies for reporting periods ending on or after 30 September 2021.
Last Date of Compliance: for reporting periods ending on or after 30 September 2021
Interpretation/Simplification: The requirements of this reporting standard are applicable for all reporting periods that conclude on or after September 30, 2021.

Text: 7. An ADI or RFC to which the Reporting Standard applies must provide APRA with the information required by this Reporting Standard for each reporting period on a domestic books consolidation.
Compliance To be Done: Submit required information to APRA for each reporting period, based on domestic books consolidation.
Interpretation/Simplification: If your institution meets the applicability criteria, you must regularly submit the specified housing credit and interest rate information to APRA, using data from your domestic consolidated financial records.

Text: 8. The information required by this Reporting Standard must be given to APRA in electronic format, using the ‘Direct to APRA’ application or by a method (i.e. a web-based solution) notified by APRA, in writing, prior to submission.
Interpretation/Simplification: All required information must be submitted to APRA electronically, either through the 'Direct to APRA' (D2A) application or another web-based method officially communicated by APRA prior to submission.

Text: Note: the Direct to APRA application software (also known as D2A) may be obtained from APRA.
Interpretation/Simplification: The 'Direct to APRA' (D2A) software, used for electronic submissions, is available from APRA.

Text: 9. The information required by this Reporting Standard must be provided in respect of each calendar month by an ADI or RFC to which this Reporting Standard applies under paragraphs 4 or 5.
Interpretation/Simplification: Institutions subject to this standard must submit the required information monthly, based on each calendar month.

Text: 10. The information required by this Reporting Standard must be provided to APRA within 15 business days after the end of the reporting period to which the information relates.
Last Date of Compliance: within 15 business days after the end of the reporting period
Interpretation/Simplification: Reports must be submitted to APRA no later than 15 business days following the conclusion of each monthly reporting period.

Text: 11. APRA may, by notice in writing, change the reporting periods, or specified reporting periods, for a particular ADI or RFC, to require it to provide the information required by this Reporting Standard more frequently, or less frequently, having regard to: (a) the particular circumstances of the ADI or RFC; and (b) the extent to which the information is required for the purposes of the ABS or RBA.
Interpretation/Simplification: APRA has the discretion to alter an institution's reporting frequency (either more or less often) by providing written notice, taking into account the institution's specific situation and the data needs of the ABS or RBA.

Text: 12. APRA may grant an ADI or RFC an extension of a due date, in writing, in which case the new due date for the provision of the information will be the date on the notice of extension.
Interpretation/Simplification: APRA can grant written extensions for reporting deadlines. If an extension is granted, the new due date will be specified in the extension notice.

Text: 13. All information provided by an ADI or RFC under this Reporting Standard must be the product of systems, processes and controls that have been reviewed and tested by the external auditor of the ADI or RFC as set out in Prudential Standard APS 310 Audit and Related Matters for ADIs or Reporting Standard RRS 710.0 ABS/RBA Audit Requirements for Registered Financial Corporations for RFCs. Relevant standards and guidance statements issued by the Auditing and Assurance Standards Board provide information on the scope and nature of the review and testing required from external auditors. This review and testing must be done on an annual basis or more frequently if required by the external auditor to enable the external auditor to form an opinion on the accuracy and reliability of the information provided by an ADI or RFC under this Reporting Standard.
Last Date of Compliance: annual basis or more frequently if required by the external auditor
Interpretation/Simplification: The data submitted must originate from systems and controls that your external auditor has reviewed and tested annually (or more frequently if deemed necessary), in accordance with specified audit standards, to confirm the information's accuracy and reliability.

Text: 14. All information provided by an ADI or RFC under this Reporting Standard must be subject to systems, processes and controls developed by the ADI or RFC for the internal review and authorisation of that information. These systems, processes and controls are to assure the completeness and reliability of the information provided.
Interpretation/Simplification: Your institution must implement and maintain internal systems, processes, and controls to review and authorize all submitted information, thereby ensuring its completeness and reliability.

Text: 15. When an officer or agent of an ADI or RFC submits information under this Reporting Standard and uses the D2A application, or other method notified by APRA, it will be necessary for the officer or agent to digitally sign the relevant information using a digital certificate or other digital identity credential acceptable to APRA.
Interpretation/Simplification: Any officer or agent submitting data electronically (via D2A or another APRA-approved method) must digitally sign the submission using a digital certificate or identity credential approved by APRA.

Text: 16. Terms that are defined in ARS 701.0 appear in bold and italics in this Reporting Standard.
Interpretation/Simplification: Any terms shown in bold and italics within this document have their definitions provided in Reporting Standard ARS 701.0.

Text: 17. In this Reporting Standard: due date means the last day of the 15 business days provided for in paragraph 10 or, if applicable, the date on a notice of extension given under paragraph 12.
Interpretation/Simplification: The 'due date' for submissions is defined as 15 business days after the end of the reporting period, or a later date if an extension is officially granted by APRA.

Text: reporting period means a month of a year as provided for in paragraph 9 or, if applicable, the date on a notice given under paragraph 11.
Interpretation/Simplification: A 'reporting period' refers to a calendar month, unless APRA has formally notified a different period for a specific institution.

Text: 18. Unless the contrary intention appears, any reference to an Act, Prudential Standard, Reporting Standard, Australian Accounting or Auditing Standard is a reference to the instrument as in force or existing from time to time.
Interpretation/Simplification: Any mention of other Acts, Prudential Standards, Reporting Standards, or Accounting/Auditing Standards within this document refers to their most current and up-to-date versions.

Interpretation/Simplification: Header for instructions on how to report data and in what units.

Sub-section: Reporting basis and unit of measurement
Text: These instructions specify the reporting basis and unit of measurement that applies to each item.
Interpretation/Simplification: The document will detail the specific format and units for each data point to be reported.

Sub-section: Reporting basis and unit of measurement
Text: For reporting purposes, unless specified otherwise, enter data as a positive number.
Interpretation/Simplification: Always report numerical data as positive values, unless there is a specific instruction to do otherwise for a particular item.

Text: Counterparties
Interpretation/Simplification: Header for the section defining who the loans are to.

Text: For the purposes of this form, report only finance to households for housing purposes.
Interpretation/Simplification: Only include loans given to individuals or families for housing-related reasons; exclude corporate loans or loans for other purposes.

Text: For the purposes of this form, households may exist in either the resident or non-resident sectors.
Interpretation/Simplification: Households for reporting purposes can be either those residing in Australia or those residing outside Australia.

Text: Positions with resident and non-resident households are collected separately.
Interpretation/Simplification: You must maintain and report separate data for loans to resident households and loans to non-resident households.

Text: Types of finance
Interpretation/Simplification: Header for the section defining what types of financial instruments are to be included.

Text: For the purposes of this form, finance includes loans.
Interpretation/Simplification: Clarifies that 'finance' in this context encompasses various forms of loans.

Text: When reporting information on the stock of outstanding finance (e.g. credit outstanding), only include finance that is held on-balance sheet, unless otherwise directed.
Interpretation/Simplification: For outstanding loans (credit outstanding), only report those that appear on your institution's balance sheet, unless specific instructions state to include off-balance sheet items.

Text: Reporting by purpose
Interpretation/Simplification: Header for the section on classifying loans by their intended use.

Text: Classify finance at the lowest level at which it is able to be identified; the purpose that the funds will be used for determines whether (and where) it is reported on this form.
Interpretation/Simplification: Loans must be categorized as precisely as possible based on their ultimate purpose, as this purpose dictates how and where they appear on the report.

Text: Where finance (identified at the lowest available level) is to be used for more than one purpose,
Interpretation/Simplification: Provides context for how to classify loans that serve multiple purposes, implying further instruction on this scenario (even if the sentence is incomplete).

Text: classify that finance to its predominant purpose (based on the purpose for which the largest share of the funds will be used).
Interpretation/Simplification: When classifying financial products, assign them to the category that represents the main use of the funds.

Text: Report outstanding finance under the category in which it sits as at the reporting date.
Interpretation/Simplification: Report current outstanding finance based on its classification at the reporting date, regardless of its original classification.

Text: For example, if a loan was originally classified as having a fixed interest rate but now has a variable interest rate then it must be reported as variable interest rate for the current reporting period.
Interpretation/Simplification: If a loan's interest rate type changes, report its current interest rate type for the current reporting period.

Text: Where there is a finance facility with a mix of interest rate or repayment types, follow the instructions below unless otherwise directed.
Interpretation/Simplification: Special instructions apply for finance facilities that have a combination of interest rate or repayment types.

Text: When reporting on the number of facilities, report each facility once.
Interpretation/Simplification: Each facility should only be counted once in the report.

Text: Where interest rate types or repayment types are separately identified, report the number of facilities according to the predominant interest rate type or repayment type by value.
Interpretation/Simplification: If a facility has multiple interest or repayment types, classify it based on the type that represents the largest monetary value.

Text: When reporting the value of finance, apportion across the relevant interest rate type and/or repayment type dimensions.
Interpretation/Simplification: Allocate the total value of finance across the different interest rate and repayment type categories as appropriate.

Text: When reporting the weighted average interest rate, weight each interest rate by its corresponding balance outstanding.
Interpretation/Simplification: Calculate the weighted average interest rate using the outstanding balance for each individual interest rate.

Text: Unless otherwise specifically stated, information reported on this form must comply with Australian Accounting Standards.
Interpretation/Simplification: All data submitted on this form must adhere to Australian Accounting Standards, unless an explicit exception is provided.

Text: Report monetary amounts on ARF 744.0A in Australian dollars or the Australian dollar equivalent of the foreign currency.
Interpretation/Simplification: All monetary values in the ARF 744.0A report must be in Australian Dollars (AUD) or converted to AUD.

Text: Convert amounts denominated in foreign currency to AUD in accordance with AASB 121 The Effects of Changes in Foreign Exchange Rates (AASB 121).
Interpretation/Simplification: Follow AASB 121 standards when converting foreign currency amounts into AUD.

Text: Report values on ARF 744.0A as whole dollars.
Interpretation/Simplification: Monetary values on the ARF 744.0A form should be rounded to the nearest whole dollar.

Text: Report numbers on ARF 744.0A unscaled, as whole numbers for ADIs and RFCs.
Interpretation/Simplification: For ADIs and RFCs, numerical counts on ARF 744.0A must be reported as unscaled, whole numbers.

Text: Report averages on ARF 744.0A unscaled, as numbers to two decimal places.
Interpretation/Simplification: Averages on ARF 744.0A should be reported unscaled and with two decimal places.

Text: ADIs and RFCs are required to report contractual interest rates.
Interpretation/Simplification: Authorized Deposit-taking Institutions (ADIs) and Registered Financial Corporations (RFCs) must report the agreed-upon contractual interest rates.

Text: Report interest rates as an annualised percentage rate (on a 365 days per year basis) to two decimal places.
Interpretation/Simplification: Interest rates should be reported as an annual percentage, calculated based on 365 days, and rounded to two decimal places.

Text: Refer to the interest rates definition for further guidance (ARS 701.0).
Interpretation/Simplification: Consult ARS 701.0 for detailed definitions of interest rates.

Text: Authorised Version F2021L01107 registered 13/08/2021
Interpretation/Simplification: This document is the officially registered version, effective from August 13, 2021.

Text: Report cost of funds and margin items as an annualised percentage rate to two decimal places.
Interpretation/Simplification: Cost of funds and margin should be reported as annual percentages, rounded to two decimal places.

Text: Report items on ARF 744.0A with accounting type of debit (assets).
Interpretation/Simplification: Items representing assets on ARF 744.0A must be recorded with a debit accounting type.

Text: The accounting type (i.e. credit or debit) applies to all monetary items and represents the natural accounting type of the item collected.
Interpretation/Simplification: The credit or debit accounting type for each monetary item should reflect its standard accounting nature.

Text: Terms highlighted in bold italics are defined in ARS 701.0.
Interpretation/Simplification: Refer to ARS 701.0 for definitions of terms formatted in bold italics within this document.

Text: All derived fields in the form are shaded in grey are explained in words as a mathematical expression in these instructions.
Interpretation/Simplification: Fields shaded in grey on the form are calculated, and their calculation methods are described here.

Text: Examples included under ‘Include’ and ‘Exclude’ must not be taken as an exhaustive list of items to be included or excluded.
Interpretation/Simplification: The provided 'Include' and 'Exclude' lists are examples only and should not be considered comprehensive.

Text:
1. 
Housing loans outstanding
Interpretation/Simplification: This section provides instructions for reporting existing housing loans.

Text: Item 1 collects information on the stock of credit outstanding to households for housing by property purpose, type of interest rate and repayment type.
Interpretation/Simplification: Item 1 requires data on the current total of housing loans owed by households, categorized by the loan's purpose, interest rate type, and repayment method.

Text: Reporting basis: report item 1 as at the end of the reporting period.
Last Date of Compliance: as at the end of the reporting period
Interpretation/Simplification: Data for Item 1 must reflect the situation at the close of the reporting period.

Text: Report loans to non-residents in item 1.3 only.
Interpretation/Simplification: Loans made to non-residents must only be reported under item 1.3.

Text: Exclude facilities with a nil credit outstanding balance.
Interpretation/Simplification: Do not include loan facilities that have no outstanding credit balance.

Text:
Column 1 
Report the number of housing loan facilities with credit outstanding.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Column 1, provide the total count of housing loan facilities that currently have an outstanding credit balance.

Text:
Column 2 
Report the value of credit outstanding, net of offset account balances for 
housing loans.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Column 2, report the total value of outstanding housing loan credit, after subtracting any amounts in associated offset accounts.

Text:
Column 3 
Report the weighted average interest rate on credit outstanding, net of 
offset accounts for housing loans.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Column 3, report the average interest rate, weighted by the outstanding credit (minus offset account balances) for housing loans.

Text:
Column 4 
Report the value of credit outstanding for housing loans.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Column 4, report the total value of outstanding credit for all housing loans.

Text:
Column 5 
Report the weighted average interest rate on credit outstanding for 
housing loans.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Column 5, report the average interest rate, weighted by the total outstanding credit for housing loans.

Text:
Column 6 
Report the cost of funds for housing loans with credit outstanding.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Column 6, report the cost associated with funding housing loans that have an outstanding balance.

Text:
Column 7 
Report the margin for housing loans with credit outstanding.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Column 7, report the margin achieved on housing loans that have an outstanding balance.

Text: Column 7 is a derived item. Report column 7 as column 5 less column 6.
Interpretation/Simplification: Column 7 (Margin) is calculated by subtracting Column 6 (Cost of Funds) from Column 5 (Weighted Average Interest Rate).

Text:
Item 1.1 
Report total owner-occupied housing loans to residents.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Item 1.1, report all housing loans for properties occupied by their owners, extended to residents.

Text: Item 1.1 is a derived item.
Interpretation/Simplification: Item 1.1 is a calculated value, not directly entered.

Text:
Report the number and values (columns 1, 2, and 4) in item 1.1 as the sum 
of item 1.1.2.1 and item 1.1.2.2.
Interpretation/Simplification: For Item 1.1, the counts and values for columns 1, 2, and 4 are the sum of items 1.1.2.1 and 1.1.2.2.

Text:
The number and values (columns 1, 2, and 4) in item 1.1 also equal the 
sum of item 1.1.3.1 and item 1.1.3.2.
Interpretation/Simplification: Alternatively, the counts and values for Item 1.1 (columns 1, 2, and 4) can be calculated as the sum of items 1.1.3.1 and 1.1.3.2.

Text:
Report the interest rate, cost of funds and margin (columns 3, 5, 6 and 7) 
in item 1.1 as the weighted average of item 1.1.2.1 and item 1.1.2.2.
Interpretation/Simplification: For Item 1.1, the interest rate, cost of funds, and margin (columns 3, 5, 6, and 7) are calculated as the weighted average of items 1.1.2.1 and 1.1.2.2.

Text:
The interest rate, cost of funds and margin (columns 3, 5, 6 and 7) in 
item 1.1 also equal the weighted average of item 1.1.3.1 and item 1.1.3.2.
Interpretation/Simplification: Alternatively, the interest rate, cost of funds, and margin for Item 1.1 (columns 3, 5, 6, and 7) can be calculated as the weighted average of items 1.1.3.1 and 1.1.3.2.

Text:
The value of credit outstanding reported in item 1.1 (column 4) equals 
item 1.1.1.1.1.1 (column 1) on ARF 720.1A/B.
Interpretation/Simplification: The value of outstanding credit in Item 1.1, Column 4, must match the value reported in Item 1.1.1.1.1.1, Column 1, of ARF 720.1A/B.

Text:
Item 1.1.1 
Of the amount reported in item 1.1, report revolving credit facilities.
Interpretation/Simplification: From the total in Item 1.1, specifically report the portion that relates to revolving credit facilities.

Text:
Item 1.1.2 
Report owner-occupied housing loans according to their interest rate 
type in items 1.1.2.1 and 1.1.2.2.
Interpretation/Simplification: Report owner-occupied housing loans, distinguishing them by interest rate type (fixed vs. variable), in sub-items 1.1.2.1 and 1.1.2.2.

Text:
Item 1.1.2.1 
Report owner-occupied housing loans to residents with a fixed interest 
rate.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Item 1.1.2.1, report all owner-occupied housing loans to residents that have a fixed interest rate.

Text:
The value of credit outstanding with a fixed interest rate reported in item 
1.1.2.1 (column 4) equals item 2.1.1.1 (column 1) on ARF 720.1A/B.
Interpretation/Simplification: The value of outstanding fixed-interest credit in Item 1.1.2.1, Column 4, must correspond to Item 2.1.1.1, Column 1, of ARF 720.1A/B.

Text:
Item 1.1.2.2 
Report owner-occupied housing loans to residents with a variable 
interest rate.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Item 1.1.2.2, report all owner-occupied housing loans to residents that have a variable interest rate.

Text:
The value of credit outstanding with a variable interest rate reported in 
item 1.1.2.2 (column 4) equals item 2.1.1.2 (column 1) on ARF 720.1A/B.
Interpretation/Simplification: The value of outstanding variable-interest credit in Item 1.1.2.2, Column 4, must correspond to Item 2.1.1.2, Column 1, of ARF 720.1A/B.

Text:
Item 1.1.3 
Report owner-occupied housing loans according to their repayment type 
in items 1.1.3.1 and 1.1.3.2.
Interpretation/Simplification: Report owner-occupied housing loans, distinguishing them by repayment type (interest-only vs. amortizing), in sub-items 1.1.3.1 and 1.1.3.2.

Text:
Item 1.1.3.1 
Report owner-occupied housing loans to residents for interest-only 
loans.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Item 1.1.3.1, report all owner-occupied housing loans to residents that are interest-only loans.

Text:
Item 1.1.3.2 
Report owner-occupied housing loans to residents for amortising loans.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Item 1.1.3.2, report all owner-occupied housing loans to residents that are amortizing loans (principal and interest).

Text:
Item 1.2 
Report total investor housing loans to residents with credit outstanding.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Item 1.2, report all outstanding housing loans granted to residents for investment purposes.

Text: Item 1.2 is a derived item.
Interpretation/Simplification: Item 1.2 is a calculated value, not directly entered.

Text:
Report the number and values (columns 1, 2, and 4) in item 1.2 as the sum 
of item 1.2.2.1 and item 1.2.2.2.
Interpretation/Simplification: For Item 1.2, the counts and values for columns 1, 2, and 4 are the sum of items 1.2.2.1 and 1.2.2.2.

Text:
The number and values (columns 1, 2, and 4) in item 1.2 also equal the 
sum of item 1.2.3.1 and item 1.2.3.2.
Interpretation/Simplification: Alternatively, the counts and values for Item 1.2 (columns 1, 2, and 4) can be calculated as the sum of items 1.2.3.1 and 1.2.3.2.

Text:
Report the interest rate, cost of funds and margin (columns 3, 5, 6 and 7) 
in item 1.2 as the weighted average of item 1.2.2.1 and item 1.2.2.2.
Interpretation/Simplification: For Item 1.2, the interest rate, cost of funds, and margin (columns 3, 5, 6, and 7) are calculated as the weighted average of items 1.2.2.1 and 1.2.2.2.

Text:
The interest rate, cost of funds and margin (columns 3, 5, 6 and 7) in 
item 1.2 also equal the weighted average of item 1.2.3.1 and item 1.2.3.2.
Interpretation/Simplification: Alternatively, the interest rate, cost of funds, and margin for Item 1.2 (columns 3, 5, 6, and 7) can be calculated as the weighted average of items 1.2.3.1 and 1.2.3.2.

Text:
The value of credit outstanding in item 1.2 (column 4) equals item 
1.1.1.1.1.2 (column 1) on ARF 720.1A/B.
Interpretation/Simplification: The value of outstanding credit in Item 1.2, Column 4, must match the value reported in Item 1.1.1.1.1.2, Column 1, of ARF 720.1A/B.

Text:
Item 1.2.1 
Of the amount reported in item 1.2, report revolving credit facilities.
Interpretation/Simplification: From the total in Item 1.2, specifically report the portion that relates to revolving credit facilities.

Text:
Item 1.2.2 
Report housing loans for investment according to their interest rate type 
in items 1.2.2.1 and 1.2.2.2.
Interpretation/Simplification: Report housing loans for investment purposes, distinguishing them by interest rate type (fixed vs. variable), in sub-items 1.2.2.1 and 1.2.2.2.

Text:
Item 1.2.2.1 
Report investor housing loans to residents with a fixed interest rate.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Item 1.2.2.1, report all investor housing loans to residents that have a fixed interest rate.

Text:
The value of credit outstanding with a fixed interest rate reported in item 
1.2.2.1 (column 4) equals item 2.1.1.1 (column 2) on ARF 720.1A/B.
Interpretation/Simplification: The value of outstanding fixed-interest credit in Item 1.2.2.1, Column 4, must correspond to Item 2.1.1.1, Column 2, of ARF 720.1A/B.

Text:
Item 1.2.2.2 
Report investor housing loans to residents with a variable interest rate.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Item 1.2.2.2, report all investor housing loans to residents that have a variable interest rate.

Text:
The value of credit outstanding with a variable interest rate reported in 
item 1.2.2.2 (column 4) equals item 2.1.1.2 (column 2) on ARF 720.1A/B.
Interpretation/Simplification: The value of outstanding variable-interest credit in Item 1.2.2.2, Column 4, must correspond to Item 2.1.1.2, Column 2, of ARF 720.1A/B.

Text:
Item 1.2.3 
Report investor housing loans according to their repayment type in items 
1.2.3.1 and 1.2.3.2.
Interpretation/Simplification: Report investor housing loans, distinguishing them by repayment type (interest-only vs. amortizing), in sub-items 1.2.3.1 and 1.2.3.2.

Text:
Item 1.2.3.1 
Report investor housing loans to residents for interest-only loans.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Item 1.2.3.1, report all investor housing loans to residents that are interest-only loans.

Text:
Item 1.2.3.2 
Report investor housing loans to residents for amortising loans.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Item 1.2.3.2, report all investor housing loans to residents that are amortizing loans.

Text:
Item 1.3 
Report housing loans to non-residents.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Item 1.3, report all housing loans that have been issued to non-residents.

Sub-section: Housing loans funded in the month
Text:
2. 
Housing loans funded in the month
Interpretation/Simplification: This section provides instructions for reporting housing loans that were newly funded during the reporting month.

Text: Item 2 collects information on the flow of housing finance funded in the reporting period by property purpose, type of interest rate, repayment type and purpose sub-class.
Interpretation/Simplification: Item 2 requires data on newly funded housing finance during the reporting period, categorized by property purpose, interest rate type, repayment type, and detailed purpose sub-class.

Text:
Reporting basis: report item 2 during the reporting period or as at the end of the reporting 
period as directed.
Last Date of Compliance: during the reporting period or as at the end of the reporting period as directed
Interpretation/Simplification: Data for Item 2 should be reported based on activities during the reporting period or balances at period-end, as specified by further instructions.

Text: Report loans to non-residents in item 2.2 only.
Interpretation/Simplification: Loans made to non-residents that were funded must only be reported under item 2.2.

Text:
For item 2, report all amounts funded during the reporting period, irrespective of whether or 
not they were drawn.
Interpretation/Simplification: For Item 2, report the full amount of all loans committed and funded during the period, even if the funds have not yet been disbursed to the borrower.

Text:
Report values gross of offset account balances (i.e. do not subtract 
offset account balances) and of redraw facilities (i.e. do not subtract the amounts available in 
redraw facilities).
Interpretation/Simplification: Report the total value of funded loans without deducting any amounts from offset accounts or available redraw facilities.

Text:
Column 1 
Report the number of owner-occupied housing loan facilities that were 
funded during the reporting period.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Column 1, report the count of new housing loan facilities for owner-occupied properties that were funded during the reporting period.

Text:
Column 2 
Report the value of credit for owner-occupied housing loans that was 
funded.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Column 2, report the total monetary value of new credit funded for owner-occupied housing loans.

Text:
For internal refinances report the total value refinanced, not just the 
increase in the credit limit.
Interpretation/Simplification: When reporting internal refinances, include the full refinanced amount, not only the increased portion of the credit limit.

Text:
Column 3 
Report the weighted average interest rate as at the end of the reporting 
period on owner-occupied housing loans that were funded.
Last Date of Compliance: as at the end of the reporting period
Interpretation/Simplification: In Column 3, report the weighted average interest rate for new owner-occupied housing loans, as recorded at the end of the reporting period.

Text:
Column 4 
Report the cost of funds as at the end of the reporting period for owner-occupied housing loans that were funded.
Last Date of Compliance: as at the end of the reporting period
Interpretation/Simplification: In Column 4, report the cost of funds for new owner-occupied housing loans, as recorded at the end of the reporting period.

Text:
Column 5 
Report the margin as at the end of the reporting period for owner-
occupied housing loans that were funded.
Last Date of Compliance: as at the end of the reporting period
Interpretation/Simplification: In Column 5, report the margin for new owner-occupied housing loans, as recorded at the end of the reporting period.

Text:
Column 5 is a derived column. Report column 5 as column 3 less column 
4.
Interpretation/Simplification: Column 5 (Margin) is calculated by subtracting Column 4 (Cost of Funds) from Column 3 (Weighted Average Interest Rate).

Text:
Column 6 
Report the number of investment housing loan facilities that were 
funded.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Column 6, report the count of new housing loan facilities for investment properties that were funded.

Text:
Column 7 
Report the value of credit for investment housing loans that was funded.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Column 7, report the total monetary value of new credit funded for investment housing loans.

Text:
For internal refinances report the total value refinanced, not just the 
increase in the credit limit.
Interpretation/Simplification: When reporting internal refinances for investment loans, include the full refinanced amount, not only the increased portion of the credit limit.

Text:
Column 8 
Report the weighted average interest rate as at the end of the reporting 
period on investment housing loans that were funded.
Last Date of Compliance: as at the end of the reporting period
Interpretation/Simplification: In Column 8, report the weighted average interest rate for new investment housing loans, as recorded at the end of the reporting period.

Text:
Column 9 
Report the cost of funds as at the end of the reporting period for 
investment housing loans that were funded.
Last Date of Compliance: as at the end of the reporting period
Interpretation/Simplification: In Column 9, report the cost of funds for new investment housing loans, as recorded at the end of the reporting period.

Text:
Column 10 
Report the margin as at the end of the reporting period for investment 
housing loans that were funded.
Last Date of Compliance: as at the end of the reporting period
Interpretation/Simplification: In Column 10, report the margin for new investment housing loans, as recorded at the end of the reporting period.

Text:
Column 10 is a derived column. Report column 10 as column 8 less 
column 9.
Interpretation/Simplification: Column 10 (Margin) is calculated by subtracting Column 9 (Cost of Funds) from Column 8 (Weighted Average Interest Rate).

Text:
Item 2.1 
Report housing loans to residents.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Item 2.1, report all housing loans newly funded for residents.

Text: Item 2.1 is a derived item.
Interpretation/Simplification: Item 2.1 is a calculated value, not directly entered.

Text:
Report the number and values (columns 1, 2, 6 and 7) in item 2.1 as the 
sum of item 2.1.3.1 and item 2.1.3.2.
Interpretation/Simplification: For Item 2.1, the counts and values for columns 1, 2, 6, and 7 are the sum of items 2.1.3.1 and 2.1.3.2.

Text:
The number and values (columns 1, 2, 6 and 7) in item 2.1 also equal the 
sum of item 2.1.4.1 and item 2.1.4.2.
Interpretation/Simplification: Alternatively, the counts and values for Item 2.1 (columns 1, 2, 6, and 7) can be calculated as the sum of items 2.1.4.1 and 2.1.4.2.

Text:
Report the interest rate, cost of funds and margin (columns 3, 4, 5, 8, 9 
and 10) in item 2.1 as the weighted average of item 2.1.3.1 and 
item 2.1.3.2.
Interpretation/Simplification: For Item 2.1, the interest rate, cost of funds, and margin (columns 3, 4, 5, 8, 9, and 10) are calculated as the weighted average of items 2.1.3.1 and 2.1.3.2.

Text:
The interest rate, cost of funds and margin (columns 3, 4, 5, 8, 9 and 10) 
in item 2.1 also equal the weighted average of item 2.1.4.1 and 
item 2.1.4.2.
Interpretation/Simplification: Alternatively, the interest rate, cost of funds, and margin for Item 2.1 (columns 3, 4, 5, 8, 9, and 10) can be calculated as the weighted average of items 2.1.4.1 and 2.1.4.2.

Text:
Item 2.1.1 
Of the amount reported in item 2.1, report revolving credit facilities.
Interpretation/Simplification: From the total newly funded loans in Item 2.1, specifically report the portion that relates to revolving credit facilities.

Text:
Item 2.1.2 
Of the amount reported in item 2.1, report finance for the construction of 
new dwellings.
Interpretation/Simplification: From the total newly funded loans in Item 2.1, specifically report the portion allocated for the construction of new dwellings.

Text:
Item 2.1.3 
Report housing loans to residents by interest rate type for items 2.1.3.1 
and 2.1.3.2.
Interpretation/Simplification: Report newly funded housing loans to residents, categorized by their interest rate type (fixed vs. variable), in sub-items 2.1.3.1 and 2.1.3.2.

Text:
Item 2.1.3.1 
Report housing loans to residents with a fixed interest rate.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Item 2.1.3.1, report newly funded housing loans to residents that have a fixed interest rate.

Text:
Item 2.1.3.1.1 
Of the amount reported in item 2.1.3.1, report housing loans to first-
home buyers.
Interpretation/Simplification: From the fixed-interest housing loans to residents in Item 2.1.3.1, specifically report those granted to first-home buyers.

Text:
Item 2.1.3.2 
Report housing loans to residents with a variable interest rate.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Item 2.1.3.2, report newly funded housing loans to residents that have a variable interest rate.

Text:
Item 2.1.3.2.1 
Of the amount reported in item 2.1.3.2, report housing loans to first-
home buyers.
Interpretation/Simplification: From the variable-interest housing loans to residents in Item 2.1.3.2, specifically report those granted to first-home buyers.

Text:
Item 2.1.4 
Report housing loans to residents by repayment type for items 2.1.4.1
Interpretation/Simplification: Report newly funded housing loans to residents, categorized by their repayment type (e.g., interest-only or amortizing), starting with item 2.1.4.1.

Text: July 2021 ARF 744.0A Instructions - 7
Interpretation/Simplification: This is a document header indicating the version and page number of the instructions.

Text: Report housing loans to residents for interest-only loans.
Compliance To be Done: Report interest-only housing loans provided to residents.
Interpretation/Simplification: Provide data specifically on housing loans to residents where only interest is paid (not principal).

Text: Report housing loans to residents for amortising loans.
Compliance To be Done: Report amortising housing loans provided to residents.
Interpretation/Simplification: Provide data specifically on housing loans to residents where both principal and interest are repaid over time.

Text: Report housing loans to non-residents.
Compliance To be Done: Report housing loans provided to non-residents.
Interpretation/Simplification: Provide data on all housing loans extended to individuals who are not residents.

Text: 3. Housing loans to residents funded in month – by size
Interpretation/Simplification: This is the title for Section 3, which covers housing loans to residents funded in the reporting month, categorized by loan size.

Text: Item 3 collects information on the flow of new finance to resident households for housing loans funded during the reporting period by the size of the loan amount at commitment.
Interpretation/Simplification: Item 3 requires data on new housing loans issued to resident households during the reporting period, specifically broken down by the initial committed loan amount.

Text: Reporting basis: report item 3 during the reporting period or as at the end of the reporting period as directed.
Interpretation/Simplification: Data for Item 3 must be reported either for the entire reporting period or as a snapshot at the end of the period, as specified by instructions.

Text: Exclude finance to non-residents from item 3.
Interpretation/Simplification: Do not include any loans made to non-residents in the report for Item 3.

Text: Calculate the value at commitment at the facility level (for instance, considering the fixed interest rate and variable interest rate components of a split loan as one facility).
Interpretation/Simplification: When determining the committed loan value, treat all parts of a single loan (e.g., fixed and variable rate portions) as one overall facility.

Text: If the loan (or facility) is for multiple purposes, report the entire loan (facility) value according to the predominant purpose.
Interpretation/Simplification: For loans used for several purposes, classify and report the full loan amount under its primary purpose.

Text: Include the entire value of the commitment in the reporting period in which it is funded, not just the amount drawn in that reporting period.
Interpretation/Simplification: Report the full committed amount of a loan in the period it was funded, even if only a portion of the loan was actually drawn down by the borrower in that period.

Text: In the event of an internal refinance, report the new value at commitment using the entire new loan balance.
Interpretation/Simplification: If a loan is refinanced internally, report the total new loan amount as the commitment value.

Text: If the loan is disbursed over a period of time (multiple drawdowns) then report the entire loan as being funded in the reporting period in which the funds are first made available to the borrower. Note that this differs from the standard treatment elsewhere in this form.
Interpretation/Simplification: For loans with multiple disbursements, the whole loan should be considered funded and reported in the period when the first funds became available to the borrower. This is a specific deviation from other reporting rules.

Text: Report according to the property purpose (see item 3 for further details).
Compliance To be Done: Report data in Column 1 based on the property's purpose.
Interpretation/Simplification: Fill Column 1 by classifying loans based on whether the property is for owner-occupation or investment, as detailed in Item 3.

Text: Report according to the loan value at commitment (see item 3 for further details).
Compliance To be Done: Report data in Column 2 based on the loan value at commitment.
Interpretation/Simplification: Fill Column 2 by categorizing loans based on their committed monetary value, as detailed in Item 3.

Text: Report the number of housing loan facilities funded in the reporting period.
Compliance To be Done: Report the total count of housing loan facilities funded in the reporting period.
Interpretation/Simplification: Provide the total number of housing loan facilities for which funding was provided during the reporting period in Column 3.

Text: Report the value of housing loans funded in the reporting period.
Compliance To be Done: Report the total monetary value of housing loans funded in the reporting period.
Interpretation/Simplification: Provide the aggregate monetary value of all housing loans that received funding during the reporting period in Column 4.

Text: Report the weighted average interest rate as at the end of the reporting period on housing loans funded in the reporting period.
Compliance To be Done: Report the weighted average interest rate for housing loans funded in the period.
Interpretation/Simplification: Provide the average interest rate for housing loans funded during the period, weighted by loan value, calculated as of the period's end, in Column 5.

Text: Report housing loans to residents funded in the reporting period for each combination of property purpose and value at commitment category.
Compliance To be Done: Provide a detailed report of housing loans to residents by property purpose and commitment value category.
Interpretation/Simplification: You must provide a comprehensive report on housing loans issued to residents during the period, breaking down the data by both the property's use and the loan's initial size category.

Text: The property purposes are:  owner-occupied; and  investment.
Interpretation/Simplification: This defines the two categories for property use: whether the owner lives in it, or if it's held for investment.

Text: Authorised Version F2021L01107 registered 13/08/2021

Text: July 2021 ARF 744.0A Instructions - 8
Interpretation/Simplification: This is a document header indicating the version and page number of the instructions.

Text: The value at commitment categories are:  size of the loan amount at commitment was greater than $0 and less than or equal to $200 000;  size of the loan amount at commitment was greater than $200 000 and less than or equal to $400 000;  size of the loan amount at commitment was greater than $400 000 and less than or equal to $600 000;  size of the loan amount at commitment was greater than $600 000 and less than or equal to $800 000  size of the loan amount at commitment was greater than $800 000 and less than or equal to $1 000 000;  size of the loan amount at commitment was greater than $1 000 000 and less than or equal to $1 500 000;  size of the loan amount at commitment was greater than $1 500 000 and less than or equal to $2 000 000;  size of the loan amount at commitment was greater than $2 000 000 and less than or equal to $3 000 000; and  size of the loan amount at commitment was greater than $3 000 000.
Interpretation/Simplification: This defines the specific financial ranges used to categorize housing loans based on their initial committed amount for reporting purposes.

Text: 4. Housing loans to residents funded in the month – by loan-to-valuation ratio (at commitment)
Interpretation/Simplification: This is the title for Section 4, which covers housing loans to residents funded in the reporting month, categorized by their loan-to-valuation ratio at commitment.

Text: Item 4 collects information on the flow of new finance to resident households for housing loans funded during the reporting period by loan-to-valuation ratio at commitment.
Interpretation/Simplification: Item 4 requires data on new housing loans issued to resident households during the reporting period, specifically broken down by the Loan-to-Valuation Ratio (LVR) at the time of commitment.

Text: Reporting basis: report item 4 during the reporting period or as at the end of the reporting period as directed.
Interpretation/Simplification: Data for Item 4 must be reported either for the entire reporting period or as a snapshot at the end of the period, as specified by instructions.

Text: Exclude finance to non-residents from item 4.
Interpretation/Simplification: Do not include any loans made to non-residents in the report for Item 4.

Text: Report the number, value and interest rate according to the characteristics of the loan (or facility) funded during the reporting period, even where the loan-to-valuation ratio calculated for that loan (or facility) includes other claims on the borrower – for example, due to second mortgage status or the nomination of more than one property as security.
Interpretation/Simplification: When reporting loan data (number, value, interest rate), base it on the individual loan's characteristics, even if its Loan-to-Valuation Ratio (LVR) calculation factors in additional debts or multiple properties as collateral.

Text: If the loan (or facility) is for multiple purposes, report the entire loan (facility) value according to the predominant purpose.
Interpretation/Simplification: For loans used for several purposes, classify and report the full loan amount under its primary purpose (specific to Item 4).

Text: Include the entire value of the commitment in the month in which it is funded, not just the amount drawn in that month.
Interpretation/Simplification: Report the full committed amount of a loan in the month it was funded, even if only a portion of the loan was actually drawn down by the borrower in that month (specific to Item 4).

Text: In the event of an internal refinance, report the new value at commitment using the entire new loan balance.
Interpretation/Simplification: If a loan is refinanced internally, report the total new loan amount as the commitment value (specific to Item 4).

Text: If the loan is disbursed over a period of time (multiple drawdowns) then report the entire loan as being funded in the reporting period in which the funds are first made available to the borrower. Note that this differs from the standard treatment elsewhere in this form.
Interpretation/Simplification: For loans with multiple disbursements, the whole loan should be considered funded and reported in the period when the first funds became available to the borrower. This is a specific deviation from other reporting rules (specific to Item 4).

Text: Report according to the property purpose (see item 4 for further details).
Compliance To be Done: Report data in Column 1 based on the property's purpose.
Interpretation/Simplification: Fill Column 1 by classifying loans based on whether the property is for owner-occupation or investment, as detailed in Item 4.

Text: Authorised Version F2021L01107 registered 13/08/2021
Interpretation/Simplification: This is a document footer indicating the official version and registration date of the document.

Text: July 2021 ARF 744.0A Instructions - 9
Interpretation/Simplification: This is a document header indicating the version and page number of the instructions.

Text: Report according to the loan-to-valuation ratio at commitment (see item 4 for further details).
Compliance To be Done: Report data in Column 2 based on the loan-to-valuation ratio at commitment.
Interpretation/Simplification: Fill Column 2 by categorizing loans based on their Loan-to-Valuation Ratio (LVR) at the time of commitment, as detailed in Item 4.

Text: Report the number of housing loan facilities funded in the reporting period.
Compliance To be Done: Report the total count of housing loan facilities funded in the reporting period.
Interpretation/Simplification: Provide the total number of housing loan facilities for which funding was provided during the reporting period in Column 3 (specific to Item 4).

Text: Report the value of housing loans funded in the reporting period.
Compliance To be Done: Report the total monetary value of housing loans funded in the reporting period.
Interpretation/Simplification: Provide the aggregate monetary value of all housing loans that received funding during the reporting period in Column 4 (specific to Item 4).

Text: Report the weighted average interest rate as at the end of the reporting period on housing loans funded in the reporting period.
Compliance To be Done: Report the weighted average interest rate for housing loans funded in the period.
Interpretation/Simplification: Provide the average interest rate for housing loans funded during the period, weighted by loan value, calculated as of the period's end, in Column 5 (specific to Item 4).

Text: Report housing loans to households funded in the reporting period for each combination of property purpose and loan-to-valuation ratio category.
Compliance To be Done: Provide a detailed report of housing loans to households by property purpose and LVR category.
Interpretation/Simplification: You must provide a comprehensive report on housing loans issued to households during the period, breaking down the data by both the property's use and its Loan-to-Valuation Ratio (LVR) category.

Text: The property purposes are:  owner-occupied; and  investment.
Interpretation/Simplification: This defines the two categories for property use: whether the owner lives in it, or if it's held for investment (specific to Item 4).

Text: The loan-to-valuation ratio categories are:  where the loan-to-valuation ratio at commitment was less than 40 per cent;  where the loan-to-valuation ratio at commitment was greater than or equal to 40 per cent and less than 60 per cent;  where the loan-to-valuation ratio at commitment was greater than or equal to 60 per cent and less than 80 per cent;  where the loan-to-valuation ratio at commitment was greater than or equal to 80 per cent and less than 81 per cent;  where the loan-to-valuation ratio at commitment was greater than or equal to 81 per cent and less than 85 per cent;  where the loan-to-valuation ratio at commitment was greater than or equal to 85 per cent and less than 90 per cent;  where the loan-to-valuation ratio at commitment was greater than or equal to 90 per cent and less than 95 per cent;  where the loan-to-valuation ratio at commitment was greater than or equal to 95 per cent;  where the loan was unsecured; and  where the loan-to-valuation ratio at commitment was unknown.
Interpretation/Simplification: This defines the specific percentage ranges for categorizing housing loans based on their Loan-to-Valuation Ratio (LVR) at commitment, including categories for unsecured and unknown LVRs.

Text: Report the average loan-to-valuation ratio at commitment for loans funded during the reporting period, weighted by loan size at commitment.
Compliance To be Done: Report the weighted average LVR at commitment for loans funded during the period.
Interpretation/Simplification: Provide the average Loan-to-Valuation Ratio (LVR) for loans funded during the reporting period, with the average weighted by the size of each loan at commitment.

Text: 5. Fixed interest rate housing loans to residents – by residual term
Interpretation/Simplification: This is the title for Section 5, which covers fixed interest rate housing loans to residents, categorized by their remaining fixed interest term.

Text: Item 5 collects information on the flow of new fixed interest rate housing loans funded during the reporting period and the stock of fixed interest rate housing loans with credit outstanding to resident households by the residual term of the fixed interest rate period.
Interpretation/Simplification: Item 5 requires data on both newly funded fixed-rate housing loans and the existing outstanding amount of fixed-rate housing loans to resident households, categorized by the remaining duration of their fixed interest rate period.

Text: Authorised Version F2021L01107 registered 13/08/2021

Text: July 2021 ARF 744.0A Instructions - 10
Interpretation/Simplification: This is a document header indicating the version and page number of the instructions.

Text: Reporting basis: report item 5 as at the end of the reporting period or during the reporting period as directed.
Interpretation/Simplification: Data for Item 5 must be reported either as a snapshot at the end of the reporting period or for the entire period, as specified by instructions.

Text: If the loan (or facility) is for multiple purposes, report the entire loan (facility) value according to the predominant purpose.
Interpretation/Simplification: For loans used for several purposes, classify and report the full loan amount under its primary purpose (specific to Item 5).

Text: When reporting the number of facilities, report each facility with a fixed interest rate component once, regardless of whether this is the predominant interest rate type by value. Note that this differs from the standard treatment elsewhere in this form.
Interpretation/Simplification: Each loan facility containing any fixed interest rate component should be counted only once, even if the fixed rate isn't the main interest rate by value for that loan. This is an exception to other counting rules in this form.

Text: Exclude finance to non-residents from item 5.
Interpretation/Simplification: Do not include any loans made to non-residents in the report for Item 5.

Text: For item 5, report all amounts funded during the reporting period, irrespective of whether or not they were drawn down. Report values gross of offset account balances (i.e. do not subtract offset account balances) and of redraw facilities (i.e. do not subtract the amounts available in redraw facilities).
Interpretation/Simplification: For Item 5, include all funded amounts, regardless of actual drawdown. Report the total loan value without deducting any offset account balances or available redraw amounts.

Text: Report according to the property purpose of the loans (see item 5 for further details).
Compliance To be Done: Report data in Column 1 based on the property's purpose.
Interpretation/Simplification: Fill Column 1 by classifying loans based on whether the property is for owner-occupation or investment, as detailed in Item 5.

Text: Report according to the residual term of the fixed interest rate period of housing loans (see item 5 for further details).
Compliance To be Done: Report data in Column 2 based on the remaining fixed interest rate term.
Interpretation/Simplification: Fill Column 2 by categorizing fixed-rate housing loans based on how much time is left in their fixed interest rate period, as detailed in Item 5.

Text: Report the total number of housing loan facilities with a fixed interest rate component that have credit outstanding on that fixed interest rate component as at the end of the month.
Compliance To be Done: Report the total count of outstanding fixed-rate housing loan facilities.
Interpretation/Simplification: Provide the total count of housing loan facilities that include a fixed interest rate component and have an outstanding balance on that component at the end of the month in Column 3.

Text: Report the value of housing loans with a fixed interest rate that have credit outstanding.
Compliance To be Done: Report the total monetary value of outstanding fixed-rate housing loans.
Interpretation/Simplification: Provide the aggregate monetary value of all fixed interest rate housing loans that still have an outstanding balance in Column 4.

Text: Report the weighted average interest rate on housing loans with a fixed interest rate as at the end of the reporting period.
Compliance To be Done: Report the weighted average interest rate for outstanding fixed-rate housing loans.
Interpretation/Simplification: Provide the average interest rate for outstanding fixed interest rate housing loans, weighted by loan value, calculated as of the end of the reporting period, in Column 5.

Text: Report the weighted average residual fixed term on housing loans with a fixed interest rate and credit outstanding as at the end of the reporting period.
Compliance To be Done: Report the weighted average remaining fixed term for outstanding fixed-rate housing loans.
Interpretation/Simplification: Provide the average remaining duration of the fixed interest rate period for outstanding fixed-rate housing loans, weighted by loan value, calculated as of the end of the reporting period, in Column 6.

Text: To calculate and report this item, express each term as the number of days remaining to maturity/365 days.
Interpretation/Simplification: When calculating the residual fixed term for Column 6, convert it into years by dividing the remaining days by 365.

Text: Unit of measurement: report item 5 (column 6) as a number to two decimal places.
Interpretation/Simplification: The value reported in Column 6 of Item 5 must be a number rounded to two decimal places.

Text: Report the total number of housing loan facilities with a fixed interest rate component funded in the month.
Compliance To be Done: Report the total count of newly funded fixed-rate housing loan facilities in the month.
Interpretation/Simplification: Provide the total number of new housing loan facilities that include a fixed interest rate component and were funded during the month in Column 7.

Text: Report the value of housing loans with a fixed interest rate funded in the month.
Compliance To be Done: Report the total monetary value of newly funded fixed-rate housing loans in the month.
Interpretation/Simplification: Provide the aggregate monetary value of all new fixed interest rate housing loans that were funded during the month in Column 8.

Text: Report the weighted average interest rate as at the end of the reporting period on housing loans with a fixed interest rate funded in the reporting period.
Compliance To be Done: Report the weighted average interest rate for newly funded fixed-rate housing loans.
Interpretation/Simplification: Provide the average interest rate for new fixed interest rate housing loans funded during the period, weighted by loan value, calculated as of the period's end, in Column 9.

Interpretation/Simplification: Provide the average remaining duration of the fixed interest rate period for new fixed-rate housing loans funded during the period, weighted by loan value, calculated as of the period's end, in Column 10.

Text: Report fixed interest rate housing loans with credit outstanding as at the end of the reporting period and fixed interest rate housing loans funded in the reporting period to resident households for each combination of property purpose and residual term.
Compliance To be Done: Report outstanding and newly funded fixed-rate housing loans to residents by property purpose and residual term.
Interpretation/Simplification: You must provide a comprehensive report on both existing outstanding fixed-rate housing loans and newly funded fixed-rate housing loans to resident households, categorizing them by the property's purpose and the remaining duration of their fixed interest rate.

Text: For housing credit outstanding the total value (column 4) and the total weighted average interest rate (column 5) reported in item 5 for:  owner-occupied housing loans equals item 1.1.2.1 (column 4) and item 1.1.2.1 (column 5) respectively; and  investment housing loans equals item 1.2.2.1 (column 4) and item 1.2.2.1 (column 5) respectively.

Text: July 2021 ARF 744.0B - 1 ARF_744_0B: ABS/RBA Housing Credit Stocks, Flows and Interest Rates (Reduced)
Interpretation/Simplification: This is the title and reference code for the ABS/RBA Housing Credit Stocks, Flows and Interest Rates (Reduced) reporting form, issued in July 2021.

Text: Australian Business Number Institution Name Reporting Period Scale Factor Monthly Reporting Consolidation Domestic
Interpretation/Simplification: These are the mandatory identifying details and parameters (such as ABN, Institution Name, Reporting Period, Scale Factor, Frequency, and Consolidation level) that must accompany the report submission.

Text: 1. Housing loans outstanding Number of facilities Value (net of offset balances) Interest rate (net of offset balances) Value Interest rate (1) (2) (3) (4) (5)
Interpretation/Simplification: This section outlines the data points required for reporting the total volume and value of housing loans that are currently outstanding, including details on the number of facilities, their value, and associated interest rates, net of any offset balances.

Text: 1.1. Total owner-occupied housing credit outstanding to residents
Interpretation/Simplification: Institutions must report the total amount of outstanding housing credit provided to residents for owner-occupied properties.

Text: 1.1.1. of which: Revolving credit
Interpretation/Simplification: Within total owner-occupied housing credit to residents, institutions must specifically report the portion that is revolving credit.

Text: 1.1.2. By interest rate type
Interpretation/Simplification: Owner-occupied housing credit outstanding to residents must be further categorized by the type of interest rate applied.

Text: 1.1.2.1. Fixed interest rate
Interpretation/Simplification: Report the amount of owner-occupied housing credit to residents that has a fixed interest rate.

Text: 1.1.2.2. Variable interest rate
Interpretation/Simplification: Report the amount of owner-occupied housing credit to residents that has a variable interest rate.

Text: 1.1.3. By repayment type
Interpretation/Simplification: Owner-occupied housing credit outstanding to residents must be further categorized by the type of repayment structure.

Text: 1.1.3.1. Interest-only
Interpretation/Simplification: Report the amount of owner-occupied housing credit to residents that is on an interest-only repayment plan.

Text: 1.1.3.2. Amortising
Interpretation/Simplification: Report the amount of owner-occupied housing credit to residents that is on an amortising repayment plan (i.e., principal and interest).

Text: 1.2. Total investment housing credit outstanding to residents
Interpretation/Simplification: Institutions must report the total amount of outstanding housing credit provided to residents for investment properties.

Text: 1.2.1. of which: Revolving credit
Interpretation/Simplification: Within total investment housing credit to residents, institutions must specifically report the portion that is revolving credit.

Text: 1.2.2. By interest rate type
Interpretation/Simplification: Investment housing credit outstanding to residents must be further categorized by the type of interest rate applied.

Text: 1.2.2.1. Fixed interest rate
Interpretation/Simplification: Report the amount of investment housing credit to residents that has a fixed interest rate.

Text: 1.2.2.2. Variable interest rate
Interpretation/Simplification: Report the amount of investment housing credit to residents that has a variable interest rate.

Text: 1.2.3. By repayment type
Interpretation/Simplification: Investment housing credit outstanding to residents must be further categorized by the type of repayment structure.

Text: 1.2.3.1. Interest-only
Interpretation/Simplification: Report the amount of investment housing credit to residents that is on an interest-only repayment plan.

Text: 1.2.3.2. Amortising
Interpretation/Simplification: Report the amount of investment housing credit to residents that is on an amortising repayment plan (i.e., principal and interest).

Text: 1.3. Total housing credit outstanding to non-residents Owner-occupied Investment Number of facilities Value Interest rate Number of facilities Value Interest rate (1) (2) (3) (4) (5) (6)
Interpretation/Simplification: Institutions must report the total housing credit outstanding to non-residents, separating it into owner-occupied and investment categories, and providing details on the number of facilities, value, and interest rates for each.

Sub-section: Housing loans funded in the month (Header)
Text: 2. Housing loans funded in the month Owner-occupied Investment Number of facilities Value Interest rate Number of facilities Value Interest rate (1) (2) (3) (4) (5) (6)
Interpretation/Simplification: This section requires reporting on housing loans that were newly funded during the reporting month, categorized by owner-occupied and investment purposes, including the number of facilities, value, and interest rates.

Text: 2.1. Housing loans to residents funded in the month
Interpretation/Simplification: Institutions must report housing loans funded during the month that were provided to residents.

Text: 2.1.1. of which: Revolving credit
Interpretation/Simplification: Within housing loans funded for residents in the month, institutions must report the portion that is revolving credit.

Text: 2.1.2. of which: Finance for the construction of new dwellings
Interpretation/Simplification: Within housing loans funded for residents in the month, institutions must report the portion allocated to financing the construction of new residential properties.

Text: 2.1.3. By interest rate type
Interpretation/Simplification: Housing loans funded for residents in the month must be further categorized by the type of interest rate.

Text: 2.1.3.1. Fixed interest rate
Interpretation/Simplification: Report the amount of fixed interest rate housing loans funded for residents in the month.

Text: 2.1.3.1.1. of which: First-home buyers
Interpretation/Simplification: Within fixed interest rate housing loans funded for residents, specify the portion provided to first-home buyers.

Text: 2.1.3.2. Variable interest rate
Interpretation/Simplification: Report the amount of variable interest rate housing loans funded for residents in the month.

Text: 2.1.3.2.1. of which: First-home buyers
Interpretation/Simplification: Within variable interest rate housing loans funded for residents, specify the portion provided to first-home buyers.

Text: 2.1.4. By repayment type
Interpretation/Simplification: Housing loans funded for residents in the month must be further categorized by the type of repayment structure.

Text: 2.1.4.1. Interest-only
Interpretation/Simplification: Report the amount of interest-only housing loans funded for residents in the month.

Text: 2.1.4.2. Amortising
Interpretation/Simplification: Report the amount of amortising housing loans funded for residents in the month.

Text: 2.2. Housing loans to non-residents funded in the month
Interpretation/Simplification: Institutions must report housing loans funded during the month that were provided to non-residents.
